revised_title: Maximizing the Likelihood of Identifying Kinetic Gating Mechanisms for Ion Channels
tldr: The authors present a method to identify the kinetic gating mechanisms of ion channels using two-dimensional distributions of simulated dwell times. By analyzing simulated and experimental single-channel currents in an identical manner, they can compare the likelihood of the experimental data being generated by a given kinetic scheme and rate constants. This method has a greater ability to distinguish among models compared to one-dimensional distributions.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Cell Biology
